titleStmt.title: By the mayor whereas it appears by several examinations taken before me and others His Majesties justices of the peace, that there have been several endeavours and wicked contrivances influencing some apprentices and others, to enter into a detestable combination for wicked purposes against the peace and good government of this city ...
titleStmt.author: City of London (England). Lord Mayor.
Clayton, Robert, Sir, 1629-1707.

notesStmt.note: Title from first 4 lines of text.
Date of publication suggested by Wing.

"Given at Guild-Hall London, the 30th. day of March, anno Dom. 1680. And in the xxij. year of the reign of our Sovereign Lord Charles the Second, by the grace of God, of England, Scotland, France and Ireland, King, defender of the faith, &c."
Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
